toc.para: This checklist provides an overall view of the big configuration tasks. The smaller tasks are outlined within the big tasks. The checklist does not take the place of following the steps in the guide.

sect1.title: Checklist for Configuring Trusted Extensions
sect1.para: The following list summarizes what is required to install and configure Trusted Extensions at your site.

listitem.para: Read Part 1 of Solaris Trusted Extensions Administratorâ€™s Procedures
Read Site Security Policy and Trusted Extensions.
Decide the PROM or BIOS security level.
Decide the PROM or BIOS password.
Decide if attached peripherals are permitted.
Decide if access to remote printers is permitted.
Decide if access to unlabeled networks is permitted.
For remote administration, install the Developer Group or larger group of Solaris packages.
For the Clone Zone creation method, select Custom Install, then lay out a /zone partition.
Start any services that are disabled.
If using IPv6, enable IPv6 for Trusted Extensions
Configure interfaces for the global zone and for labeled zones
Either create a Trusted Extensions proxy server, or a Trusted Extensions LDAP server.
Register the Solaris Management Console with LDAP.
Create LDAP toolbox for the Solaris Management Console.
Assign LDAP server or proxy server to the cipso host type in a remote host template.
Assign local system to the cipso host type in a remote host template.
In the Solaris Management Console, associate zone names with particular labels.
(Optional) Create ZFS pool for cloning zones.
Run the Initialize for LDAP action.
Run the Shut Down Zone action.
Customize the zone while the zone is shut down.
Create the remaining zones from scratch, or by using the Copy Zone or the Clone Zone action.
Identify single-label hosts and limited range hosts.
Determine the labels to apply to incoming data from unlabeled hosts.
Configure local users and local administrative roles
Create a local user who can assume the Security Administrator role.
Create other roles, and possibly other local users to assume these roles.
Create home directories on the NFS server
Create home directories for each user at every label that the user can access.
(Optional) Prevent users from reading their lower-level home directories.
Assign the Device Management profile or the System Administrator profile to a role.
To make devices usable, do one of the following:
Assign Allocate Device authorization to selected users and roles.
Enable particular LDAP clients to be LDAP administration systems.
